verses.text: Jehovah the God of Sinai and of the sanctuary. ¶ For the Chief Musician; A Psalm of David, a Song.¶ [a]Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered; Let them also that hate him flee before him.

footnotes.a: Or, God ariseth; and so throughout verses [[1]], [[2]], [[3]]

verses.text:
As smoke is driven away, so drive them away:
    As wax melteth before the fire,
    So let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

But let the righteous be glad; let them exult before God:
    Yea, let them rejoice with gladness.

A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows,
    Is God in his holy habitation.

footnotes.c: Hebrew maketh the solitary to dwell in a house.

verses.text:
¶     O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people,
    When thou didst march through the wilderness;

The earth trembled,
    The heavens also dropped  at the presence of God:
    Yon Sinai  at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain,
    Thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
Thy [d]congregation dwelt therein: Thou, O God, didst prepare of thy goodness for the poor.

The Lord giveth the word:
    The women that publish the tidings are a great host.

Kings of armies flee, they flee;
    And she that tarrieth at home divideth the spoil.
[e]When ye lie among the sheepfolds, the wings of a dove covered with silver, And her pinions with yellow gold.

footnotes.e: Or, Will ye lie among the sheepfolds, as the wings . . . gold?

verses.text:
When the Almighty scattered kings therein,
     it snoweth in Zalmon.
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; A [g]high mountain is the mountain of Bashan.

Why look ye askance, ye high mountains,
    At the mountain which God hath desired for his abode?
    Yea, Jehovah will dwell  for ever.
The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands upon thousands: The Lord is among them, [h] Sinai, in the sanctuary.
¶ Blessed be [k]the Lord, who daily beareth our burden, Even the God who is our salvation.

footnotes.k: Or, the Lord day by day: if one oppresseth us, God is our salvation

verses.text:
God is unto us a God of deliverances;
    And unto Jehovah the Lord belongeth escape from death.

But God will smite through the head of his enemies,
    The hairy scalp of such a one as goeth on still in his guiltiness.

The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan,
    I will bring  again from the depths of the sea;

That thou mayest crush ,  thy foot in blood,
    That the tongue of thy dogs may have its portion from  enemies.
They have seen thy goings, O God, Even the goings of my God, my King, [l]into the sanctuary.

The singers went before, the minstrels followed after,
    In the midst of the damsels playing with timbrels.

Bless ye God in the congregations,
    Even the Lord,  of the fountain of Israel.
There is little Benjamin their ruler, The princes of Judah their [m]council, The princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
¶ Thy God hath commanded thy strength: [n]Strengthen, O God, that which thou [o]hast wrought for us.

footnotes.n: Or, Be strong, O God, thou that hast etc.

footnotes.o: Or, hast wrought for us out of thy temple. Unto Jerusalem etc.

verses.text:
Because of thy temple at Jerusalem
    Kings shall bring presents unto thee.
Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, The multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples, [p]Trampling under foot the pieces of silver: [q]He hath scattered the peoples that delight in war.

footnotes.p: Or, Every one submitting himself with pieces of silver

verses.text: Princes shall come out of Egypt; [r]Ethiopia shall haste to stretch out her hands unto God.

Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;
    Oh sing praises unto the Lord;

To him that rideth upon the heaven of heavens, which are of old;
    Lo, he uttereth his voice, a mighty voice.

Ascribe ye strength unto God:
    His excellency is over Israel,
    And his strength is in the skies.
[s]O God, terrible out of thy holy places: The God of Israel, he giveth strength and power unto people. Blessed be God.
